headline.seo: Strauss-Kahn Prosecution Said to Be Ending

docs.lead_paragraph: District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. of Manhattan will ask a judge to dismiss the sexual assault case against Dominique Strauss-Kahn, a person briefed on the matter said.

headline.main: A Year Later, Marriott Isn't Big Enough

docs.abstract: New York Marriott Brooklyn, first full-service hotel to open in borough in 70 years, boasts of success and reportedly plans to expand; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: When Marriott International opened a large hotel on Adams Street near the Brooklyn Bridge last year, it seemed like a bold move. Business travelers to Brooklyn already had their pick of accommodations in lower Manhattan. Tourists in the borough seemed so unusual that they made headlines. Now the New York Marriott Brooklyn, the first full-service hotel to open in the borough in 70 years, is boasting of success and planning an expansion. Officials at the Muss Development Company, developer of the 376-room Marriott, would not discuss a report in The Park Slope Paper that the developer planned to add 280 more rooms. But Mitchell Heymann, the hotel's marketing director, confirmed that the project was taking shape. ''We're confident there's an opportunity to fill more guest rooms,'' he said Wednesday.
docs.snippet: When Marriott International opened a large hotel on Adams Street near the Brooklyn Bridge last year, it seemed like a bold move. Business travelers to Brooklyn already had their pick of accommodations in lower Manhattan. Tourists in the borough se...

headline.main: A Nice Place to Visit; A Hotel! Bus Tours! Brooklyn Hits the Tourist Map

docs.abstract: Article discusses growing popularity of Brooklyn on New York City tourist lists; several locations in borough that have been included on New York City travel tours discussed; opening of new Marriott Hotel in downtown Brooklyn noted; photo; map (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: In Manhattan, sure. But Brooklyn? Still, there they are, those big red double-decker tourist buses chugging past Fulton Landing, around Grand Army Plaza and in the shadow of the sleek, 376-room Marriott that is to open Tuesday as Brooklyn's first large new hotel in 68 years. ''Everybody has heard something about Brooklyn,'' said Claudia Pongratz, a tourist from Munich, Germany, who squeezed onto the upper level of a double decker the other day with other first-time visitors to New York City's most populous borough, most of them from Europe. ''It is part of America I have always wanted to see.''

headline.main: Sleeping Over During A Layover at de Gaulle

docs.abstract: Aviation buffs can get a thrill at Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris, France--and a night's sleep; new Sheraton Hotel is inside Terminal 2; interior has been designed to look likr a ship by Andree Putnam, who designed interior of the Concorde and Morgans Hotel in New York (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Aviation buffs can get a thrill at Charles de Gaulle -- and a night's sleep. The new 254-room Sheraton, which opened earlier this year, is actually inside Terminal 2. The bow-shaped interior has been designed as a ship by Andree Putman, who designed the interior of the Concorde and Morgans Hotel in New York. Rooms have ''jet lag'' massage chairs, fax ports and a trouser press. Other amenities include free laundry service, saunas, meeting rooms and a spa. Soundproofed rooms look out on runways. Rates range from about $100 to $300. Call ITT Sheraton at (800) 325-3535.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: After reading "Monte Carlo: It's a Rich Experience" by Alan Riding (Feb. 13), we thought your readers might also be interested in Loews Monte Carlo Hotel as another lodging option. The resort and convention complex has 639 guest rooms and suites, each with a private balcony or terrace, seven restaurants and lounges, and function space that can accommodate more than 2,000 people. The hotel also features a casino and slot machines, state-of-the art fitness center, and year-round heated rooftop swimming pool.
